park_model

Class JobSchedule

  • java.lang.Object
    • park_model.JobSchedule

  • public class JobSchedule
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      JobSchedule()
      Constructs a list of all jobs in the system from the back-end data.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean addJob(Job job)
      Adds a job to the list of jobs if it doesn't violate any business rules; returns true if job successfully added, false otherwise.
      java.util.List<Volunteer> getJobsByPark(java.lang.String thePark)
      Returns an unmodifiable list of future jobs scheduled at the given park.
      java.util.List<Volunteer> getJobsForSignUp(Volunteer theVolunteer)
      Returns an unmodifiable list of jobs that the volunteer can sign up for, excluding all jobs that violate business rules.
      java.util.List<Volunteer> getUpcomingJobsByVolunteer(Volunteer theVolunteer)
      Returns an unmodifiable list of future jobs that the given volunteer is signed up for.
      void saveList()
      Writes all list information to the back-end storage.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • getUpcomingJobsByVolunteer

        public java.util.List<Volunteer> getUpcomingJobsByVolunteer(Volunteer theVolunteer)
        Returns an unmodifiable list of future jobs that the given volunteer is signed up for.
        Parameters:
        theVolunteer - The volunteer being searched for.
        Returns:
        An unmodifiable list of future jobs that the given volunteer is signed up for. Delete the following note when you are done: See http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/util/Collections.html#unmodifiableList(java.util.List)
